result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeffrey P Arndt was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jeffrey P Arndt was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 8 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine, paid in full.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Brookfield Police Dept. Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. Ignition Interlock device to be installed in any vehicle operated. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
  *No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 8 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Count 1

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Restitution for W.L. listed in the complaint. Paid in full.
Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Character Letter, received and filed in court.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jeffrey P Arndt in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek. 

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to both counts 1 & 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 1 & 2.
Count 3 is dismissed as a read in.
Count 4 is dismissed by operation of law.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison:   5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2 Years.
Extended Supervision: 3 Years.
8 Days Credit.
Concurrent to:  Count 2
  
36  Months D/L REVOCATION
36  Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
DNA sample to be provided.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $24 (to be forward to City of Brookfield Police Department);
FINE:  $2,327
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply bail to restitution first then costs/fines/surcharges on counts 1 & 2.
Any balance to be refunded to the posting party.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  






Count 2:
Total Prison:  3.5  Years.
Initial Confinement:  1.5 Years.
Extended Supervision: 2 Years.
8 Days Credit.
Concurrent to:  Count 1.
  
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
Same as count 1.

Restitution:  $630.60 (to be paid to victim (W.L. listed in the complaint) to be paid before costs/fines/surcharges).
Costs:  $268
DNA Surcharge:  $250   DNA Sample:  Court Waives - Already order on count 1. 
Apply Bail to restitution first then costs/fines/surcharges on counts 1 & 2.  
Any balance to be refunded to the posting party.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  



Defendant remanded to the custody of the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant to be transferred to DCI - FORWITH.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
